text:
Q: Field missing on "Select Field" on Grafana A:

I found the solution. My problem was that my field was a string instead of an integer.

I found it using the Query Inspector :Explore → Query Inspector -> Query type: logs

In the Query panel, you will get something like this:

{
  "name": "number",
  "type": "string",
  "typeInfo": {
    "frame": "string",
    "nullable": true
  },
...
},

The solution is to either edit the type from the data source or use the Convert field type transformation.

Q: Localize cell depending on different column A:

OK, I will edit my answer, split it into 2 questions, and will submit the code I have but needs modification and maybe sample data, which I first need to extract from the current userform.

Q: JQ - Filtering Out JSON Properties Where Keys Do Not Match Length A:

Manipulate all key/value pairs using with_entries, and select (keep) only those entries where the length of .key matches your criteria:

jq 'with_entries(select(.key | length == 11))'

{
  "18003432343": ....,
  "18005553332": ....
}

Demo

Q: JQ - Converting JSON To JSONL Without Losing Original Object Structure A:

Use to_entries to decompose the top-level object into key/value pairs first, and then do the iteration. Eventually, re-compose each item into its own object by collecting the single item into a one-element array, and apply from_entries to it:

jq -c 'to_entries[] | [.] | from_entries'

{"18003432343":{"04:00:25":{....},"12:00:25":{....}}}
{"18005553332":{"18:11:25":{....},"23:00:25":{....}}}

Demo

Q: Macro to return a value and with goto inside A:

It is not best option. The answers provided by you by the reference I am sure were upvoted by low qualified programmers. I showed there how the code can be written wuthout using any goto statement.

Q: How to verify GameKit LocalPlayer auth signature on external server? A:

Since you're calculating the payload hash yourself, you need to tell public_key.verify() this by specifying utils.Prehashed(hashes.SHA256()) instead of just hashes.SHA256() (where utils is primitives.asymmetric.utils).

Alternatively, you can get verify() to calculate the hash itself by passing client_payload directly to verify() - in which case you drop the utils.Prehashed (and don't calculate the hash yourself).

(Also make sure you're using the correct playerID - either teamPlayerID or gamePlayerID, depending on the specific circumstances of your app. Exactly how to tell which to use under what circumstances is a mystery for another day.)
